description: Describes the specified security groups or all of your security groups.

parameters.name: GroupIds
parameters.description: The IDs of the security groups. Required for security groups in a nondefault VPC. Default: Describes all of your security groups. (string) ---

parameters.name: GroupNames
parameters.description: [Default VPC] The names of the security groups. You can specify either the security group name or the security group ID. Default: Describes all of your security groups. (string) ---

parameters.name: Filters
parameters.description: The filters. If using multiple filters for rules, the results include security groups for which any combination of rules - not necessarily a single rule - match all filters. description - The description of the security group. egress.ip-permission.cidr - An IPv4 CIDR block for an outbound security group rule. egress.ip-permission.from-port - For an outbound rule, the start of port range for the TCP and UDP protocols, or an ICMP type number. egress.ip-permission.group-id - The ID of a security group that has been referenced in an outbound security group rule. egress.ip-permission.group-name - The name of a security group that is referenced in an outbound security group rule. egress.ip-permission.ipv6-cidr - An IPv6 CIDR block for an outbound security group rule. egress.ip-permission.prefix-list-id - The ID of a prefix list to which a security group rule allows outbound access. egress.ip-permission.protocol - The IP protocol for an outbound security group rule ( tcp | udp | icmp, a protocol number, or -1 for all protocols). egress.ip-permission.to-port - For an outbound rule, the end of port range for the TCP and UDP protocols, or an ICMP code. egress.ip-permission.user-id - The ID of an Amazon Web Services account that has been referenced in an outbound security group rule. group-id - The ID of the security group. group-name - The name of the security group. ip-permission.cidr - An IPv4 CIDR block for an inbound security group rule. ip-permission.from-port - For an inbound rule, the start of port range for the TCP and UDP protocols, or an ICMP type number. ip-permission.group-id - The ID of a security group that has been referenced in an inbound security group rule. ip-permission.group-name - The name of a security group that is referenced in an inbound security group rule. ip-permission.ipv6-cidr - An IPv6 CIDR block for an inbound security group rule. ip-permission.prefix-list-id - The ID of a prefix list from which a security group rule allows inbound access. ip-permission.protocol - The IP protocol for an inbound security group rule ( tcp | udp | icmp, a protocol number, or -1 for all protocols). ip-permission.to-port - For an inbound rule, the end of port range for the TCP and UDP protocols, or an ICMP code. ip-permission.user-id - The ID of an Amazon Web Services account that has been referenced in an inbound security group rule. owner-id - The Amazon Web Services account ID of the owner of the security group. tag:<key> - The key/value combination of a tag assigned to the resource. Use the tag key in the filter name and the tag value as the filter value. For example, to find all resources that have a tag with the key Owner and the value TeamA, specify tag:Owner for the filter name and TeamA for the filter value. tag-key - The key of a tag assigned to the resource. Use this filter to find all resources assigned a tag with a specific key, regardless of the tag value. vpc-id - The ID of the VPC specified when the security group was created. (dict) --- A filter name and value pair that is used to return a more specific list of results from a describe operation. Filters can be used to match a set of resources by specific criteria, such as tags, attributes, or IDs. If you specify multiple filters, the filters are joined with an AND, and the request returns only results that match all of the specified filters. For more information, see List and filter using the CLI and API in the Amazon EC2 User Guide. Name (string) --- The name of the filter. Filter names are case-sensitive. Values (list) --- The filter values. Filter values are case-sensitive. If you specify multiple values for a filter, the values are joined with an OR, and the request returns all results that match any of the specified values. (string) ---

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: The token to include in another request to get the next page of items. This value is null when there are no more items to return.

nested_items.name: SecurityGroups
nested_items.description: Information about the security groups.

nested_items.name: GroupId
nested_items.description: The ID of the security group.

nested_items.name: IpPermissionsEgress
nested_items.description: The outbound rules associated with the security group.

nested_items.name: IpProtocol
nested_items.description: The IP protocol name ( tcp, udp, icmp, icmpv6) or number (see Protocol Numbers).

nested_items.name: FromPort
nested_items.description: If the protocol is TCP or UDP, this is the start of the port range. If the protocol is ICMP or ICMPv6, this is the ICMP type or -1 (all ICMP types).

nested_items.name: ToPort
nested_items.description: If the protocol is TCP or UDP, this is the end of the port range. If the protocol is ICMP or ICMPv6, this is the ICMP code or -1 (all ICMP codes). If the start port is -1 (all ICMP types), then the end port must be -1 (all ICMP codes).

nested_items.name: UserIdGroupPairs
nested_items.description: The security group and Amazon Web Services account ID pairs.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: A description for the security group rule that references this user ID group pair.

nested_items.name: UserId
nested_items.description: The ID of an Amazon Web Services account.

nested_items.name: GroupName
nested_items.description: [Default VPC] The name of the security group. For a security group in a nondefault VPC, use the security group ID.

nested_items.name: GroupId
nested_items.description: The ID of the security group.

nested_items.name: VpcId
nested_items.description: The ID of the VPC for the referenced security group, if applicable.

nested_items.name: VpcPeeringConnectionId
nested_items.description: The ID of the VPC peering connection, if applicable.

nested_items.name: PeeringStatus
nested_items.description: The status of a VPC peering connection, if applicable.

nested_items.name: IpRanges
nested_items.description: The IPv4 address ranges.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: A description for the security group rule that references this IPv4 address range.

nested_items.name: CidrIp
nested_items.description: The IPv4 address range. You can either specify a CIDR block or a source security group, not both. To specify a single IPv4 address, use the /32 prefix length.

nested_items.name: Ipv6Ranges
nested_items.description: The IPv6 address ranges.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: A description for the security group rule that references this IPv6 address range.

nested_items.name: CidrIpv6
nested_items.description: The IPv6 address range. You can either specify a CIDR block or a source security group, not both. To specify a single IPv6 address, use the /128 prefix length.

nested_items.name: PrefixListIds
nested_items.description: The prefix list IDs.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: A description for the security group rule that references this prefix list ID.

nested_items.name: PrefixListId
nested_items.description: The ID of the prefix.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: Any tags assigned to the security group.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The key of the tag.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value of the tag.

nested_items.name: VpcId
nested_items.description: The ID of the VPC for the security group.

nested_items.name: SecurityGroupArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the security group.

nested_items.name: OwnerId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services account ID of the owner of the security group.

nested_items.name: GroupName
nested_items.description: The name of the security group.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: A description of the security group.

nested_items.name: IpPermissions
nested_items.description: The inbound rules associated with the security group.

nested_items.name: IpProtocol
nested_items.description: The IP protocol name ( tcp, udp, icmp, icmpv6) or number (see Protocol Numbers).

nested_items.name: FromPort
nested_items.description: If the protocol is TCP or UDP, this is the start of the port range. If the protocol is ICMP or ICMPv6, this is the ICMP type or -1 (all ICMP types).

nested_items.name: ToPort
nested_items.description: If the protocol is TCP or UDP, this is the end of the port range. If the protocol is ICMP or ICMPv6, this is the ICMP code or -1 (all ICMP codes). If the start port is -1 (all ICMP types), then the end port must be -1 (all ICMP codes).
